title: Ticket #7763: notification = error doesn't send email when shadow holds the job
description:
The condor documentation claims that 

notification = error

should send email when the system (but not the user) puts the job on hold).

This is reproducible by submitting a job with an input file to be xferred that doesn't exist, and condor_submit'ing it with -disable. Note the lack of email.

The root problem here is the code in condor_utils in the shadow is checking to see if the shadow exit_code is set to JOB_SHOULD_HOLD, but this variable isn't passed in, and we just hard code -1.

There's also code for sending email when the job is released or removed. I'm having a hard time coming up with a good use case for those, and suggest we remove that in another ticket.

I'm going to squeeze the balloon a little bit and force emailHold to alway set exit_code to JOB_SHOULD_HOLD, so we don't have to replumb this in stable, but this code needs a rethinking in master.
